The document is instead a set of pension scheme rules that outline the structure, benefits, and administration of a company pension life cover scheme. 2) While the document does mention AIB life as providing insurance policies, it does not contain any provisions about claims settlement processes or third-party appointments for restitution work. 3) The document's scope is limited to defining the scheme rules, trustee duties, eligibility, and benefit calculations for a pension life cover scheme. regulation_title: Restitution work - appointment of third party
regulation_text: 361. (1) Where an insurance undertaking proposes to appoint a third party to undertake restitution work in respect of the settlement of a claim, the insurance undertaking shall provide the claimant with details of the scope of the work that has been approved by the insurance undertaking for the purposes of settlement and a detailed breakdown of the proposed cost to the insurance undertaking. (2) The information referred to in paragraph (1) shall be provided to the claimant on paper or on another durable medium in advance of the appointment of the third party.
